Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Siamycin II (BMY-29303, natural AMPs; lactam; a class 1 lasso peptide, 2S=S; XXJ; UCSB1a; bacteriocins, Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: It differs from Siamycin I only by one amino acid.  Siamycin I has a valine residue at position 4. In both peptides, disulfide bonds link Cys1 with Cys13 and Cys7 with Cys19, and the side chain of Asp9 forms an amide bond with the N-terminus (XXJ).Structure: determined in DMSO:H2O mixture (50:50), 335 NOE distance restraints were obtained, supporting a folded structure (Constantine et al., 1995).The original has been replaced since antimicrobial assays revealed no activity. APD 9/2012; 9/2017.
Literature Information.Author: Constantine KL, Friedrichs MS, Detlefsen D, Nishio M, Tsunakawa M, Furumai T, Ohkuma H, Oki T, Hill S, Bruccoleri RE, et al.1995
Literature Information.Title: High-resolution solution structure of siamycin II: novel amphipathic character of a 21-residue peptide that inhibits HIV fusion.
